/j/ is realized as a palato-alveolar fricative [Z]. The labial spirant is realized preferentially

//; in the southwest, the merger of /q/ and // and, only in a limited region, the tendency
The merger of /i/ and /u/ in closed syllables is characteristic of the nomadic dialects
(Cohen 1970). The short phonemes /a/ and // are realized variably, according to context.
In a neutral context, /a/ undergoes imla and is realized more centralized (transcribed ).

The four former diphthongs are preserved: /ay/, /aw/, /iy/, and /uw/. However, the
realization of /ay/ and /aw/ sometimes tends towards [e:] and [o:].
The stem vowels are /a/ or //; there are 3 subclasses, the most frequent being that of verbs
This type is unique, with two stem vowels /a/: gama/igama to pinch. Particular cases
developed to denote the distinction between middle/reflexive/reflexive-passive, on the one
often common to verbs with/without t: II/V tC1C2C3, tbg act of making something
